cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1115 MI...1795 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP5 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Fifteen-E Advisory Number 18 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP152017 800 PM PDT Fri Sep 15 2017
...TROPICAL DEPRESSION DRIFTING WESTWARD WITH NO CHANGE IN STRENGTH...
SUMMARY OF 800 PM PDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...16.0N 125.4W ABOUT 1115 MI...1795 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 2 MPH...4 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1006 MB...29.71 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 PM PDT (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Fifteen-E was located near latitude 16.0 North, longitude 125.4 West. The depression is moving toward the west near 2 mph (4 km/h). Little movement is expected for the next several days.
Maximum sustained winds are near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. Some strengthening is forecast during the next 48 hours, and the depression is still expected to become a tropical storm over the weekend.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1006 mb (29.71 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
NNNN
